25#ifndef _DRM_DP_HELPER_H_
26#define _DRM_DP_HELPER_H_
27
28#include <linux/types.h>
29#include <linux/i2c.h>
30#include <linux/delay.h>
31#include <linux/mutex.h>
32
33/*
34 * Unless otherwise noted, all values are from the DP 1.1a spec. Note that
35 * DP and DPCD versions are independent. Differences from 1.0 are not noted,
36 * 1.0 devices basically don't exist in the wild.
37 *
38 * Abbreviations, in chronological order:
39 *
40 * eDP: Embedded DisplayPort version 1
41 * DPI: DisplayPort Interoperability Guideline v1.1a
42 * 1.2: DisplayPort 1.2
43 * MST: Multistream Transport - part of DP 1.2a
44 *
45 * 1.2 formally includes both eDP and DPI definitions.
46 */
47
48#define DP_AUX_MAX_PAYLOAD_BYTES 16
49
50#define DP_AUX_I2C_WRITE 0x0
51#define DP_AUX_I2C_READ 0x1
52#define DP_AUX_I2C_WRITE_STATUS_UPDATE 0x2
53#define DP_AUX_I2C_MOT 0x4
54#define DP_AUX_NATIVE_WRITE 0x8
55#define DP_AUX_NATIVE_READ 0x9
56
57#define DP_AUX_NATIVE_REPLY_ACK (0x0 << 0)
58#define DP_AUX_NATIVE_REPLY_NACK (0x1 << 0)
59#define DP_AUX_NATIVE_REPLY_DEFER (0x2 << 0)
60#define DP_AUX_NATIVE_REPLY_MASK (0x3 << 0)
61
62#define DP_AUX_I2C_REPLY_ACK (0x0 << 2)
63#define DP_AUX_I2C_REPLY_NACK (0x1 << 2)
64#define DP_AUX_I2C_REPLY_DEFER (0x2 << 2)
65#define DP_AUX_I2C_REPLY_MASK (0x3 << 2)
66
67/* AUX CH addresses */
68/* DPCD */
69#define DP_DPCD_REV 0x000
70
71#define DP_MAX_LINK_RATE 0x001
72
73#define DP_MAX_LANE_COUNT 0x002
74# define DP_MAX_LANE_COUNT_MASK 0x1f
75# define DP_TPS3_SUPPORTED (1 << 6) /* 1.2 */
76# define DP_ENHANCED_FRAME_CAP (1 << 7)
77
78#define DP_MAX_DOWNSPREAD 0x003
79# define DP_NO_AUX_HANDSHAKE_LINK_TRAINING (1 << 6)
80
81#define DP_NORP 0x004
82
83#define DP_DOWNSTREAMPORT_PRESENT 0x005
84# define DP_DWN_STRM_PORT_PRESENT (1 << 0)
85# define DP_DWN_STRM_PORT_TYPE_MASK 0x06
86# define DP_DWN_STRM_PORT_TYPE_DP (0 << 1)
87# define DP_DWN_STRM_PORT_TYPE_ANALOG (1 << 1)
88# define DP_DWN_STRM_PORT_TYPE_TMDS (2 << 1)
89# define DP_DWN_STRM_PORT_TYPE_OTHER (3 << 1)
90# define DP_FORMAT_CONVERSION (1 << 3)
91# define DP_DETAILED_CAP_INFO_AVAILABLE (1 << 4) /* DPI */
92
93#define DP_MAIN_LINK_CHANNEL_CODING 0x006
94
95#define DP_DOWN_STREAM_PORT_COUNT 0x007
96# define DP_PORT_COUNT_MASK 0x0f
97# define DP_MSA_TIMING_PAR_IGNORED (1 << 6) /* eDP */
98# define DP_OUI_SUPPORT (1 << 7)
99
100#define DP_RECEIVE_PORT_0_CAP_0 0x008
101# define DP_LOCAL_EDID_PRESENT (1 << 1)
102# define DP_ASSOCIATED_TO_PRECEDING_PORT (1 << 2)
103
104#define DP_RECEIVE_PORT_0_BUFFER_SIZE 0x009
105
106#define DP_RECEIVE_PORT_1_CAP_0 0x00a
107#define DP_RECEIVE_PORT_1_BUFFER_SIZE 0x00b
108
109#define DP_I2C_SPEED_CAP 0x00c /* DPI */
110# define DP_I2C_SPEED_1K 0x01
111# define DP_I2C_SPEED_5K 0x02
112# define DP_I2C_SPEED_10K 0x04
113# define DP_I2C_SPEED_100K 0x08
114# define DP_I2C_SPEED_400K 0x10
115# define DP_I2C_SPEED_1M 0x20
116
117#define DP_EDP_CONFIGURATION_CAP 0x00d /* XXX 1.2? */
118# define DP_ALTERNATE_SCRAMBLER_RESET_CAP (1 << 0)
119# define DP_FRAMING_CHANGE_CAP (1 << 1)
120# define DP_DPCD_DISPLAY_CONTROL_CAPABLE (1 << 3) /* edp v1.2 or higher */
121
122#define DP_TRAINING_AUX_RD_INTERVAL 0x00e /* XXX 1.2? */
123
124#define DP_ADAPTER_CAP 0x00f /* 1.2 */
125# define DP_FORCE_LOAD_SENSE_CAP (1 << 0)
126# define DP_ALTERNATE_I2C_PATTERN_CAP (1 << 1)
127
128#define DP_SUPPORTED_LINK_RATES 0x010 /* eDP 1.4 */
129# define DP_MAX_SUPPORTED_RATES 8 /* 16-bit little-endian */
130
131/* Multiple stream transport */
132#define DP_FAUX_CAP 0x020 /* 1.2 */
133# define DP_FAUX_CAP_1 (1 << 0)
134
135#define DP_MSTM_CAP 0x021 /* 1.2 */
136# define DP_MST_CAP (1 << 0)
137
138#define DP_NUMBER_OF_AUDIO_ENDPOINTS 0x022 /* 1.2 */
139
140/* AV_SYNC_DATA_BLOCK 1.2 */
141#define DP_AV_GRANULARITY 0x023
142# define DP_AG_FACTOR_MASK (0xf << 0)
143# define DP_AG_FACTOR_3MS (0 << 0)
144# define DP_AG_FACTOR_2MS (1 << 0)
145# define DP_AG_FACTOR_1MS (2 << 0)
146# define DP_AG_FACTOR_500US (3 << 0)
147# define DP_AG_FACTOR_200US (4 << 0)
148# define DP_AG_FACTOR_100US (5 << 0)
149# define DP_AG_FACTOR_10US (6 << 0)
150# define DP_AG_FACTOR_1US (7 << 0)
151# define DP_VG_FACTOR_MASK (0xf << 4)
152# define DP_VG_FACTOR_3MS (0 << 4)
153# define DP_VG_FACTOR_2MS (1 << 4)
154# define DP_VG_FACTOR_1MS (2 << 4)
155# define DP_VG_FACTOR_500US (3 << 4)
156# define DP_VG_FACTOR_200US (4 << 4)
157# define DP_VG_FACTOR_100US (5 << 4)
158
159#define DP_AUD_DEC_LAT0 0x024
160#define DP_AUD_DEC_LAT1 0x025
161
162#define DP_AUD_PP_LAT0 0x026
163#define DP_AUD_PP_LAT1 0x027
164
165#define DP_VID_INTER_LAT 0x028
166
167#define DP_VID_PROG_LAT 0x029
168
169#define DP_REP_LAT 0x02a
170
171#define DP_AUD_DEL_INS0 0x02b
172#define DP_AUD_DEL_INS1 0x02c
173#define DP_AUD_DEL_INS2 0x02d
174/* End of AV_SYNC_DATA_BLOCK */
175
176#define DP_RECEIVER_ALPM_CAP 0x02e /* eDP 1.4 */
177# define DP_ALPM_CAP (1 << 0)
178
179#define DP_SINK_DEVICE_AUX_FRAME_SYNC_CAP 0x02f /* eDP 1.4 */
180# define DP_AUX_FRAME_SYNC_CAP (1 << 0)
181
182#define DP_GUID 0x030 /* 1.2 */
183
184#define DP_PSR_SUPPORT 0x070 /* XXX 1.2? */
185# define DP_PSR_IS_SUPPORTED 1
186# define DP_PSR2_IS_SUPPORTED 2 /* eDP 1.4 */
187
188#define DP_PSR_CAPS 0x071 /* XXX 1.2? */
189# define DP_PSR_NO_TRAIN_ON_EXIT 1
190# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_330 (0 << 1)
191# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_275 (1 << 1)
192# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_220 (2 << 1)
193# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_165 (3 << 1)
194# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_110 (4 << 1)
195# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_55 (5 << 1)
196# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_0 (6 << 1)
197# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_MASK (7 << 1)
198# define DP_PSR_SETUP_TIME_SHIFT 1
199
200/*
201 * 0x80-0x8f describe downstream port capabilities, but there are two layouts
202 * based on whether DP_DETAILED_CAP_INFO_AVAILABLE was set. If it was not,
203 * each port's descriptor is one byte wide. If it was set, each port's is
204 * four bytes wide, starting with the one byte from the base info. As of
205 * DP interop v1.1a only VGA defines additional detail.
206 */
207
208/* offset 0 */
209#define DP_DOWNSTREAM_PORT_0 0x80
210# define DP_DS_PORT_TYPE_MASK (7 << 0)
211# define DP_DS_PORT_TYPE_DP 0
212# define DP_DS_PORT_TYPE_VGA 1
213# define DP_DS_PORT_TYPE_DVI 2
214# define DP_DS_PORT_TYPE_HDMI 3
215# define DP_DS_PORT_TYPE_NON_EDID 4
216# define DP_DS_PORT_HPD (1 << 3)
217/* offset 1 for VGA is maximum megapixels per second / 8 */
218/* offset 2 */
219# define DP_DS_VGA_MAX_BPC_MASK (3 << 0)
220# define DP_DS_VGA_8BPC 0
221# define DP_DS_VGA_10BPC 1
222# define DP_DS_VGA_12BPC 2
223# define DP_DS_VGA_16BPC 3
224
225/* link configuration */
226#define DP_LINK_BW_SET 0x100
227# define DP_LINK_RATE_TABLE 0x00 /* eDP 1.4 */
228# define DP_LINK_BW_1_62 0x06
229# define DP_LINK_BW_2_7 0x0a
230# define DP_LINK_BW_5_4 0x14 /* 1.2 */
231
232#define DP_LANE_COUNT_SET 0x101
233# define DP_LANE_COUNT_MASK 0x0f
234# define DP_LANE_COUNT_ENHANCED_FRAME_EN (1 << 7)
235
236#define DP_TRAINING_PATTERN_SET 0x102
237# define DP_TRAINING_PATTERN_DISABLE 0
238# define DP_TRAINING_PATTERN_1 1
239# define DP_TRAINING_PATTERN_2 2
240# define DP_TRAINING_PATTERN_3 3 /* 1.2 */
241# define DP_TRAINING_PATTERN_MASK 0x3
242
243/* DPCD 1.1 only. For DPCD >= 1.2 see per-lane DP_LINK_QUAL_LANEn_SET */
244# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_11_DISABLE (0 << 2)
245# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_11_D10_2 (1 << 2)
246# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_11_ERROR_RATE (2 << 2)
247# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_11_PRBS7 (3 << 2)
248# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_11_MASK (3 << 2)
249
250# define DP_RECOVERED_CLOCK_OUT_EN (1 << 4)
251# define DP_LINK_SCRAMBLING_DISABLE (1 << 5)
252
253# define DP_SYMBOL_ERROR_COUNT_BOTH (0 << 6)
254# define DP_SYMBOL_ERROR_COUNT_DISPARITY (1 << 6)
255# define DP_SYMBOL_ERROR_COUNT_SYMBOL (2 << 6)
256# define DP_SYMBOL_ERROR_COUNT_MASK (3 << 6)
257
258#define DP_TRAINING_LANE0_SET 0x103
259#define DP_TRAINING_LANE1_SET 0x104
260#define DP_TRAINING_LANE2_SET 0x105
261#define DP_TRAINING_LANE3_SET 0x106
262
263# define DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_MASK 0x3
264# define DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_SHIFT 0
265# define DP_TRAIN_MAX_SWING_REACHED (1 << 2)
266# define DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_0 (0 << 0)
267# define DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_1 (1 << 0)
268# define DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_2 (2 << 0)
269# define DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_3 (3 << 0)
270
271# define DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPHASIS_MASK (3 << 3)
272# define DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_0 (0 << 3)
273# define DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_1 (1 << 3)
274# define DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_2 (2 << 3)
275# define DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_3 (3 << 3)
276
277# define DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPHASIS_SHIFT 3
278# define DP_TRAIN_MAX_PRE_EMPHASIS_REACHED (1 << 5)
279
280#define DP_DOWNSPREAD_CTRL 0x107
281# define DP_SPREAD_AMP_0_5 (1 << 4)
282# define DP_MSA_TIMING_PAR_IGNORE_EN (1 << 7) /* eDP */
283
284#define DP_MAIN_LINK_CHANNEL_CODING_SET 0x108
285# define DP_SET_ANSI_8B10B (1 << 0)
286
287#define DP_I2C_SPEED_CONTROL_STATUS 0x109 /* DPI */
288/* bitmask as for DP_I2C_SPEED_CAP */
289
290#define DP_EDP_CONFIGURATION_SET 0x10a /* XXX 1.2? */
291# define DP_ALTERNATE_SCRAMBLER_RESET_ENABLE (1 << 0)
292# define DP_FRAMING_CHANGE_ENABLE (1 << 1)
293# define DP_PANEL_SELF_TEST_ENABLE (1 << 7)
294
295#define DP_LINK_QUAL_LANE0_SET 0x10b /* DPCD >= 1.2 */
296#define DP_LINK_QUAL_LANE1_SET 0x10c
297#define DP_LINK_QUAL_LANE2_SET 0x10d
298#define DP_LINK_QUAL_LANE3_SET 0x10e
299# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_DISABLE 0
300# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_D10_2 1
301# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_ERROR_RATE 2
302# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_PRBS7 3
303# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_80BIT_CUSTOM 4
304# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_HBR2_EYE 5
305# define DP_LINK_QUAL_PATTERN_MASK 7
306
307#define DP_TRAINING_LANE0_1_SET2 0x10f
308#define DP_TRAINING_LANE2_3_SET2 0x110
309# define DP_LANE02_POST_CURSOR2_SET_MASK (3 << 0)
310# define DP_LANE02_MAX_POST_CURSOR2_REACHED (1 << 2)
311# define DP_LANE13_POST_CURSOR2_SET_MASK (3 << 4)
312# define DP_LANE13_MAX_POST_CURSOR2_REACHED (1 << 6)
313
314#define DP_MSTM_CTRL 0x111 /* 1.2 */
315# define DP_MST_EN (1 << 0)
316# define DP_UP_REQ_EN (1 << 1)
317# define DP_UPSTREAM_IS_SRC (1 << 2)
318
319#define DP_AUDIO_DELAY0 0x112 /* 1.2 */
320#define DP_AUDIO_DELAY1 0x113
321#define DP_AUDIO_DELAY2 0x114
322
323#define DP_LINK_RATE_SET 0x115 /* eDP 1.4 */
324# define DP_LINK_RATE_SET_SHIFT 0
325# define DP_LINK_RATE_SET_MASK (7 << 0)
326
327#define DP_RECEIVER_ALPM_CONFIG 0x116 /* eDP 1.4 */
328# define DP_ALPM_ENABLE (1 << 0)
329# define DP_ALPM_LOCK_ERROR_IRQ_HPD_ENABLE (1 << 1)
330
331#define DP_SINK_DEVICE_AUX_FRAME_SYNC_CONF 0x117 /* eDP 1.4 */
332# define DP_AUX_FRAME_SYNC_ENABLE (1 << 0)
333# define DP_IRQ_HPD_ENABLE (1 << 1)
334
335#define DP_UPSTREAM_DEVICE_DP_PWR_NEED 0x118 /* 1.2 */
336# define DP_PWR_NOT_NEEDED (1 << 0)
337
338#define DP_AUX_FRAME_SYNC_VALUE 0x15c /* eDP 1.4 */
339# define DP_AUX_FRAME_SYNC_VALID (1 << 0)
340
341#define DP_PSR_EN_CFG 0x170 /* XXX 1.2? */
342# define DP_PSR_ENABLE (1 << 0)
343# define DP_PSR_MAIN_LINK_ACTIVE (1 << 1)
344# define DP_PSR_CRC_VERIFICATION (1 << 2)
345# define DP_PSR_FRAME_CAPTURE (1 << 3)
346# define DP_PSR_SELECTIVE_UPDATE (1 << 4)
347# define DP_PSR_IRQ_HPD_WITH_CRC_ERRORS (1 << 5)
348
349#define DP_ADAPTER_CTRL 0x1a0
350# define DP_ADAPTER_CTRL_FORCE_LOAD_SENSE (1 << 0)
351
352#define DP_BRANCH_DEVICE_CTRL 0x1a1
353# define DP_BRANCH_DEVICE_IRQ_HPD (1 << 0)
354
355#define DP_PAYLOAD_ALLOCATE_SET 0x1c0
356#define DP_PAYLOAD_ALLOCATE_START_TIME_SLOT 0x1c1
357#define DP_PAYLOAD_ALLOCATE_TIME_SLOT_COUNT 0x1c2
358
359#define DP_SINK_COUNT 0x200
360/* prior to 1.2 bit 7 was reserved mbz */
361# define DP_GET_SINK_COUNT(x) ((((x) & 0x80) >> 1) | ((x) & 0x3f))
362# define DP_SINK_CP_READY (1 << 6)
363
364#define DP_DEVICE_SERVICE_IRQ_VECTOR 0x201
365# define DP_REMOTE_CONTROL_COMMAND_PENDING (1 << 0)
366# define DP_AUTOMATED_TEST_REQUEST (1 << 1)
367# define DP_CP_IRQ (1 << 2)
368# define DP_MCCS_IRQ (1 << 3)
369# define DP_DOWN_REP_MSG_RDY (1 << 4) /* 1.2 MST */
370# define DP_UP_REQ_MSG_RDY (1 << 5) /* 1.2 MST */
371# define DP_SINK_SPECIFIC_IRQ (1 << 6)
372
373#define DP_LANE0_1_STATUS 0x202
374#define DP_LANE2_3_STATUS 0x203
375# define DP_LANE_CR_DONE (1 << 0)
376# define DP_LANE_CHANNEL_EQ_DONE (1 << 1)
377# define DP_LANE_SYMBOL_LOCKED (1 << 2)
378
379#define DP_CHANNEL_EQ_BITS (DP_LANE_CR_DONE | \
380 DP_LANE_CHANNEL_EQ_DONE | \
381 DP_LANE_SYMBOL_LOCKED)
382
383#define DP_LANE_ALIGN_STATUS_UPDATED 0x204
384
385#define DP_INTERLANE_ALIGN_DONE (1 << 0)
386#define DP_DOWNSTREAM_PORT_STATUS_CHANGED (1 << 6)
387#define DP_LINK_STATUS_UPDATED (1 << 7)
388
389#define DP_SINK_STATUS 0x205
390
391#define DP_RECEIVE_PORT_0_STATUS (1 << 0)
392#define DP_RECEIVE_PORT_1_STATUS (1 << 1)
393
394#define DP_ADJUST_REQUEST_LANE0_1 0x206
395#define DP_ADJUST_REQUEST_LANE2_3 0x207
396# define DP_ADJUST_VOLTAGE_SWING_LANE0_MASK 0x03
397# define DP_ADJUST_VOLTAGE_SWING_LANE0_SHIFT 0
398# define DP_ADJUST_PRE_EMPHASIS_LANE0_MASK 0x0c
399# define DP_ADJUST_PRE_EMPHASIS_LANE0_SHIFT 2
400# define DP_ADJUST_VOLTAGE_SWING_LANE1_MASK 0x30
401# define DP_ADJUST_VOLTAGE_SWING_LANE1_SHIFT 4
402# define DP_ADJUST_PRE_EMPHASIS_LANE1_MASK 0xc0
403# define DP_ADJUST_PRE_EMPHASIS_LANE1_SHIFT 6
404
405#define DP_TEST_REQUEST 0x218
406# define DP_TEST_LINK_TRAINING (1 << 0)
407# define DP_TEST_LINK_VIDEO_PATTERN (1 << 1)
408# define DP_TEST_LINK_EDID_READ (1 << 2)
409# define DP_TEST_LINK_PHY_TEST_PATTERN (1 << 3) /* DPCD >= 1.1 */
410# define DP_TEST_LINK_FAUX_PATTERN (1 << 4) /* DPCD >= 1.2 */
411
412#define DP_TEST_LINK_RATE 0x219
413# define DP_LINK_RATE_162 (0x6)
414# define DP_LINK_RATE_27 (0xa)
415
416#define DP_TEST_LANE_COUNT 0x220
417
418#define DP_TEST_PATTERN 0x221
419
420#define DP_TEST_CRC_R_CR 0x240
421#define DP_TEST_CRC_G_Y 0x242
422#define DP_TEST_CRC_B_CB 0x244
423
424#define DP_TEST_SINK_MISC 0x246
425# define DP_TEST_CRC_SUPPORTED (1 << 5)
426# define DP_TEST_COUNT_MASK 0xf
427
428#define DP_TEST_RESPONSE 0x260
429# define DP_TEST_ACK (1 << 0)
430# define DP_TEST_NAK (1 << 1)
431# define DP_TEST_EDID_CHECKSUM_WRITE (1 << 2)
432
433#define DP_TEST_EDID_CHECKSUM 0x261
434
435#define DP_TEST_SINK 0x270
436# define DP_TEST_SINK_START (1 << 0)
437
438#define DP_PAYLOAD_TABLE_UPDATE_STATUS 0x2c0 /* 1.2 MST */
439# define DP_PAYLOAD_TABLE_UPDATED (1 << 0)
440# define DP_PAYLOAD_ACT_HANDLED (1 << 1)
441
442#define DP_VC_PAYLOAD_ID_SLOT_1 0x2c1 /* 1.2 MST */
443/* up to ID_SLOT_63 at 0x2ff */
444
445#define DP_SOURCE_OUI 0x300
446#define DP_SINK_OUI 0x400
447#define DP_BRANCH_OUI 0x500
448
449#define DP_SET_POWER 0x600
450# define DP_SET_POWER_D0 0x1
451# define DP_SET_POWER_D3 0x2
452# define DP_SET_POWER_MASK 0x3
453
454#define DP_EDP_DPCD_REV 0x700 /* eDP 1.2 */
455# define DP_EDP_11 0x00
456# define DP_EDP_12 0x01
457# define DP_EDP_13 0x02
458# define DP_EDP_14 0x03
459
460#define DP_EDP_GENERAL_CAP_1 0x701
461
462#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_ADJUSTMENT_CAP 0x702
463
464#define DP_EDP_GENERAL_CAP_2 0x703
465
466#define DP_EDP_GENERAL_CAP_3 0x704 /* eDP 1.4 */
467
468#define DP_EDP_DISPLAY_CONTROL_REGISTER 0x720
469
470#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_MODE_SET_REGISTER 0x721
471
472#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_BRIGHTNESS_MSB 0x722
473#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_BRIGHTNESS_LSB 0x723
474
475#define DP_EDP_PWMGEN_BIT_COUNT 0x724
476#define DP_EDP_PWMGEN_BIT_COUNT_CAP_MIN 0x725
477#define DP_EDP_PWMGEN_BIT_COUNT_CAP_MAX 0x726
478
479#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_CONTROL_STATUS 0x727
480
481#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_FREQ_SET 0x728
482
483#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_FREQ_CAP_MIN_MSB 0x72a
484#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_FREQ_CAP_MIN_MID 0x72b
485#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_FREQ_CAP_MIN_LSB 0x72c
486
487#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_FREQ_CAP_MAX_MSB 0x72d
488#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_FREQ_CAP_MAX_MID 0x72e
489#define DP_EDP_BACKLIGHT_FREQ_CAP_MAX_LSB 0x72f
490
491#define DP_EDP_DBC_MINIMUM_BRIGHTNESS_SET 0x732
492#define DP_EDP_DBC_MAXIMUM_BRIGHTNESS_SET 0x733
493
494#define DP_EDP_REGIONAL_BACKLIGHT_BASE 0x740 /* eDP 1.4 */
495#define DP_EDP_REGIONAL_BACKLIGHT_0 0x741 /* eDP 1.4 */
496
497#define DP_SIDEBAND_MSG_DOWN_REQ_BASE 0x1000 /* 1.2 MST */
498#define DP_SIDEBAND_MSG_UP_REP_BASE 0x1200 /* 1.2 MST */
499#define DP_SIDEBAND_MSG_DOWN_REP_BASE 0x1400 /* 1.2 MST */
500#define DP_SIDEBAND_MSG_UP_REQ_BASE 0x1600 /* 1.2 MST */
501
502#define DP_SINK_COUNT_ESI 0x2002 /* 1.2 */
503/* 0-5 sink count */
504# define DP_SINK_COUNT_CP_READY (1 << 6)
505
506#define DP_DEVICE_SERVICE_IRQ_VECTOR_ESI0 0x2003 /* 1.2 */
507
508#define DP_DEVICE_SERVICE_IRQ_VECTOR_ESI1 0x2004 /* 1.2 */
509
510#define DP_LINK_SERVICE_IRQ_VECTOR_ESI0 0x2005 /* 1.2 */
511
512#define DP_PSR_ERROR_STATUS 0x2006 /* XXX 1.2? */
513# define DP_PSR_LINK_CRC_ERROR (1 << 0)
514# define DP_PSR_RFB_STORAGE_ERROR (1 << 1)
515# define DP_PSR_VSC_SDP_UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR (1 << 2) /* eDP 1.4 */
516
517#define DP_PSR_ESI 0x2007 /* XXX 1.2? */
518# define DP_PSR_CAPS_CHANGE (1 << 0)
519
520#define DP_PSR_STATUS 0x2008 /* XXX 1.2? */
521# define DP_PSR_SINK_INACTIVE 0
522# define DP_PSR_SINK_ACTIVE_SRC_SYNCED 1
523# define DP_PSR_SINK_ACTIVE_RFB 2
524# define DP_PSR_SINK_ACTIVE_SINK_SYNCED 3
525# define DP_PSR_SINK_ACTIVE_RESYNC 4
526# define DP_PSR_SINK_INTERNAL_ERROR 7
527# define DP_PSR_SINK_STATE_MASK 0x07
528
529#define DP_RECEIVER_ALPM_STATUS 0x200b /* eDP 1.4 */
530# define DP_ALPM_LOCK_TIMEOUT_ERROR (1 << 0)
531
532/* DP 1.2 Sideband message defines */
533/* peer device type - DP 1.2a Table 2-92 */
534#define DP_PEER_DEVICE_NONE 0x0
535#define DP_PEER_DEVICE_SOURCE_OR_SST 0x1
536#define DP_PEER_DEVICE_MST_BRANCHING 0x2
537#define DP_PEER_DEVICE_SST_SINK 0x3
538#define DP_PEER_DEVICE_DP_LEGACY_CONV 0x4
539
540/* DP 1.2 MST sideband request names DP 1.2a Table 2-80 */
541#define DP_LINK_ADDRESS 0x01
542#define DP_CONNECTION_STATUS_NOTIFY 0x02
543#define DP_ENUM_PATH_RESOURCES 0x10
544#define DP_ALLOCATE_PAYLOAD 0x11
545#define DP_QUERY_PAYLOAD 0x12
546#define DP_RESOURCE_STATUS_NOTIFY 0x13
547#define DP_CLEAR_PAYLOAD_ID_TABLE 0x14
548#define DP_REMOTE_DPCD_READ 0x20
549#define DP_REMOTE_DPCD_WRITE 0x21
550#define DP_REMOTE_I2C_READ 0x22
551#define DP_REMOTE_I2C_WRITE 0x23
552#define DP_POWER_UP_PHY 0x24
553#define DP_POWER_DOWN_PHY 0x25
554#define DP_SINK_EVENT_NOTIFY 0x30
555#define DP_QUERY_STREAM_ENC_STATUS 0x38
556
557/* DP 1.2 MST sideband nak reasons - table 2.84 */
558#define DP_NAK_WRITE_FAILURE 0x01
559#define DP_NAK_INVALID_READ 0x02
560#define DP_NAK_CRC_FAILURE 0x03
561#define DP_NAK_BAD_PARAM 0x04
562#define DP_NAK_DEFER 0x05
563#define DP_NAK_LINK_FAILURE 0x06
564#define DP_NAK_NO_RESOURCES 0x07
565#define DP_NAK_DPCD_FAIL 0x08
566#define DP_NAK_I2C_NAK 0x09
567#define DP_NAK_ALLOCATE_FAIL 0x0a
568
569#define MODE_I2C_START 1
570#define MODE_I2C_WRITE 2
571#define MODE_I2C_READ 4
572#define MODE_I2C_STOP 8
573
574/* DP 1.2 MST PORTs - Section 2.5.1 v1.2a spec */
575#define DP_MST_PHYSICAL_PORT_0 0
576#define DP_MST_LOGICAL_PORT_0 8
577
578#define DP_LINK_STATUS_SIZE 6
579bool drm_dp_channel_eq_ok(const u8 link_status[DP_LINK_STATUS_SIZE],
580 int lane_count);
581bool drm_dp_clock_recovery_ok(const u8 link_status[DP_LINK_STATUS_SIZE],
582 int lane_count);
583u8 drm_dp_get_adjust_request_voltage(const u8 link_status[DP_LINK_STATUS_SIZE],
584 int lane);
585u8 drm_dp_get_adjust_request_pre_emphasis(const u8 link_status[DP_LINK_STATUS_SIZE],
586 int lane);
587
588#define DP_BRANCH_OUI_HEADER_SIZE 0xc
589#define DP_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE 0xf
590#define EDP_PSR_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE 2
591
592void drm_dp_link_train_clock_recovery_delay(const u8 dpcd[DP_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE]);
593void drm_dp_link_train_channel_eq_delay(const u8 dpcd[DP_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE]);
594
595u8 drm_dp_link_rate_to_bw_code(int link_rate);
596int drm_dp_bw_code_to_link_rate(u8 link_bw);
597
598struct edp_sdp_header {
599 u8 HB0; /* Secondary Data Packet ID */
600 u8 HB1; /* Secondary Data Packet Type */
601 u8 HB2; /* 7:5 reserved, 4:0 revision number */
602 u8 HB3; /* 7:5 reserved, 4:0 number of valid data bytes */
603} __packed;
604
605#define EDP_SDP_HEADER_REVISION_MASK 0x1F
606#define EDP_SDP_HEADER_VALID_PAYLOAD_BYTES 0x1F
607
608struct edp_vsc_psr {
609 struct edp_sdp_header sdp_header;
610 u8 DB0; /* Stereo Interface */
611 u8 DB1; /* 0 - PSR State; 1 - Update RFB; 2 - CRC Valid */
612 u8 DB2; /* CRC value bits 7:0 of the R or Cr component */
613 u8 DB3; /* CRC value bits 15:8 of the R or Cr component */
614 u8 DB4; /* CRC value bits 7:0 of the G or Y component */
615 u8 DB5; /* CRC value bits 15:8 of the G or Y component */
616 u8 DB6; /* CRC value bits 7:0 of the B or Cb component */
617 u8 DB7; /* CRC value bits 15:8 of the B or Cb component */
618 u8 DB8_31[24]; /* Reserved */
619} __packed;
620
621#define EDP_VSC_PSR_STATE_ACTIVE (1<<0)
622#define EDP_VSC_PSR_UPDATE_RFB (1<<1)
623#define EDP_VSC_PSR_CRC_VALUES_VALID (1<<2)
624
625static inline int
626drm_dp_max_link_rate(const u8 dpcd[DP_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE])
627{
628 return drm_dp_bw_code_to_link_rate(dpcd[DP_MAX_LINK_RATE]);
629}
630
631static inline u8
632drm_dp_max_lane_count(const u8 dpcd[DP_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE])
633{
634 return dpcd[DP_MAX_LANE_COUNT] & DP_MAX_LANE_COUNT_MASK;
635}
636
637static inline bool
638drm_dp_enhanced_frame_cap(const u8 dpcd[DP_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE])
639{
640 return dpcd[DP_DPCD_REV] >= 0x11 &&
641 (dpcd[DP_MAX_LANE_COUNT] & DP_ENHANCED_FRAME_CAP);
642}
643
644static inline bool
645drm_dp_tps3_supported(const u8 dpcd[DP_RECEIVER_CAP_SIZE])
646{
647 return dpcd[DP_DPCD_REV] >= 0x12 &&
648 dpcd[DP_MAX_LANE_COUNT] & DP_TPS3_SUPPORTED;
649}
650
651/*
652 * DisplayPort AUX channel
653 */
654
655/**
656 * struct drm_dp_aux_msg - DisplayPort AUX channel transaction
657 * @address: address of the (first) register to access
658 * @request: contains the type of transaction (see DP_AUX_* macros)
659 * @reply: upon completion, contains the reply type of the transaction
660 * @buffer: pointer to a transmission or reception buffer
661 * @size: size of @buffer
662 */
663struct drm_dp_aux_msg {
664 unsigned int address;
665 u8 request;
666 u8 reply;
667 void *buffer;
668 size_t size;
669};
670
671/**
672 * struct drm_dp_aux - DisplayPort AUX channel
673 * @name: user-visible name of this AUX channel and the I2C-over-AUX adapter
674 * @ddc: I2C adapter that can be used for I2C-over-AUX communication
675 * @dev: pointer to struct device that is the parent for this AUX channel
676 * @hw_mutex: internal mutex used for locking transfers
677 * @transfer: transfers a message representing a single AUX transaction
678 *
679 * The .dev field should be set to a pointer to the device that implements
680 * the AUX channel.
681 *
682 * The .name field may be used to specify the name of the I2C adapter. If set to
683 * NULL, dev_name() of .dev will be used.
684 *
685 * Drivers provide a hardware-specific implementation of how transactions
686 * are executed via the .transfer() function. A pointer to a drm_dp_aux_msg
687 * structure describing the transaction is passed into this function. Upon
688 * success, the implementation should return the number of payload bytes
689 * that were transferred, or a negative error-code on failure. Helpers
690 * propagate errors from the .transfer() function, with the exception of
691 * the -EBUSY error, which causes a transaction to be retried. On a short,
692 * helpers will return -EPROTO to make it simpler to check for failure.
693 *
694 * An AUX channel can also be used to transport I2C messages to a sink. A
695 * typical application of that is to access an EDID that's present in the
696 * sink device. The .transfer() function can also be used to execute such
697 * transactions. The drm_dp_aux_register() function registers an I2C
698 * adapter that can be passed to drm_probe_ddc(). Upon removal, drivers
699 * should call drm_dp_aux_unregister() to remove the I2C adapter.
700 * The I2C adapter uses long transfers by default; if a partial response is
701 * received, the adapter will drop down to the size given by the partial
702 * response for this transaction only.
703 *
704 * Note that the aux helper code assumes that the .transfer() function
705 * only modifies the reply field of the drm_dp_aux_msg structure. The
706 * retry logic and i2c helpers assume this is the case.
707 */
708struct drm_dp_aux {
709 const char *name;
710 struct i2c_adapter ddc;
711 struct device *dev;
712 struct mutex hw_mutex;
713 ssize_t (*transfer)(struct drm_dp_aux *aux,
714 struct drm_dp_aux_msg *msg);
715 unsigned i2c_nack_count, i2c_defer_count;
716};
717
718ssize_t drm_dp_dpcd_read(struct drm_dp_aux *aux, unsigned int offset,
719 void *buffer, size_t size);
720ssize_t drm_dp_dpcd_write(struct drm_dp_aux *aux, unsigned int offset,
721 void *buffer, size_t size);
722
723/**
724 * drm_dp_dpcd_readb() - read a single byte from the DPCD
725 * @aux: DisplayPort AUX channel
726 * @offset: address of the register to read
727 * @valuep: location where the value of the register will be stored
728 *
729 * Returns the number of bytes transferred (1) on success, or a negative
730 * error code on failure.
731 */
732static inline ssize_t drm_dp_dpcd_readb(struct drm_dp_aux *aux,
733 unsigned int offset, u8 *valuep)
734{
735 return drm_dp_dpcd_read(aux, offset, valuep, 1);
736}
737
738/**
739 * drm_dp_dpcd_writeb() - write a single byte to the DPCD
740 * @aux: DisplayPort AUX channel
741 * @offset: address of the register to write
742 * @value: value to write to the register
743 *
744 * Returns the number of bytes transferred (1) on success, or a negative
745 * error code on failure.
746 */
747static inline ssize_t drm_dp_dpcd_writeb(struct drm_dp_aux *aux,
748 unsigned int offset, u8 value)
749{
750 return drm_dp_dpcd_write(aux, offset, &value, 1);
751}
752
753int drm_dp_dpcd_read_link_status(struct drm_dp_aux *aux,
754 u8 status[DP_LINK_STATUS_SIZE]);
755
756/*
757 * DisplayPort link
758 */
759#define DP_LINK_CAP_ENHANCED_FRAMING (1 << 0)
760
761struct drm_dp_link {
762 unsigned char revision;
763 unsigned int rate;
764 unsigned int num_lanes;
765 unsigned long capabilities;
766};
767
768int drm_dp_link_probe(struct drm_dp_aux *aux, struct drm_dp_link *link);
769int drm_dp_link_power_up(struct drm_dp_aux *aux, struct drm_dp_link *link);
770int drm_dp_link_power_down(struct drm_dp_aux *aux, struct drm_dp_link *link);
771int drm_dp_link_configure(struct drm_dp_aux *aux, struct drm_dp_link *link);
772
773int drm_dp_aux_register(struct drm_dp_aux *aux);
774void drm_dp_aux_unregister(struct drm_dp_aux *aux);
775
776#endif /* _DRM_DP_HELPER_H_ */
